Description: THE GOAL OF THE PUEBLO'S LARGE-SCALE BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE AFFORDABLE, RELIABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET VIA AN INFRASTRUCTURE THAT NOT ONLY MEETS 100/100 MBPS REQUIREMENTS BUT WILL SCALE ACCORDINGLY.  UPON COMPLETION, THE NETWORK WILL HAVE 10 GBPS CAPACITY, PROVIDED THE MIDDLE-MILE SERVICE PROVIDERS CAN DELIVER 10 GBPS BROADBAND.  THE PROJECT PROPOSES THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:         FIBER BUILDOUT.        EQUIPMENT COSTS.  - HIGH-SPEED DATA TRANSMISSION FOR THE EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT DELIVERY OF AFFORDABLE INTERNET SERVICE. - ABLE TO PROVIDE COMMUNITY SERVICES IN A TIMELY MANNER.   - INCREASE PRODUCTIVITY.  - PROVIDE ADDITIONAL RESOURCES TO FIRST RESPONDERS AND TOOLS TO ENHANCE PUBLIC SAFETY, AS WELL AS THE SAFETY OF POLICE OFFICERS.   - DISTANCE LEARNING FOR REMOTE STUDENTS; HIGH-SPEED BANDWIDTH FOR REMOTE WORKERS.   THE PROJECT PROPOSES TO BRING BROADBAND SERVICE TO 75 HOUSEHOLDS WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE PUEBLO OF POJOAQUE.

THIS BROADBAND USE AND ADOPTION PROJECT WILL IMPROVE DIGITAL INCLUSION FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS BY ESTABLISHING AND IMPLEMENTING A TRIBAL-WIDE DIGITAL TRAINING PROGRAM, PROVIDING BROADBAND EQUIPMENT TO SUPPORT SCHOOLS, LIBRARIES, AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT.

THE BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT PROPOSES TO CONSTRUCT A TECHNOLOGY OFFICE WHICH WILL HOLD A SERVER ROOM AND BE OUTFITTED TO PROTECT THE EQUIPMENT FOR FUTURE GROWTH.  THE NEW TECHNOLOGY OFFICE WILL HAVE OFFICES FOR THE IT DEPARTMENT THAT WILL ALLOW FOR EASY ACCESS TO THE SERVERS AND BROADBAND EQUIPMENT, ALONG WITH A CENTRALIZED PLACE FOR PERSONNEL.

THIS PLANNING, ENGINEERING, FEASIBILITY, AND SUSTAINABILITY PROJECT WILL FUND PRE-CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING NETWORK DESIGN ENGINEERING, PERMITTING, AND AN ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW, TO PROVIDE FUTURE FIBER BROADBAND SERVICE TO 30 TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS AND THREE TRIBAL COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS.

THIS INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT PROPOSES TO CONNECT 45 UNSERVED TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS, 10 TRIBAL BUSINESSES, AND FIVE COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS TO QUALIFYING SERVICE OF 1 GBPS SYMMETRICAL VIA A 1.2-MILE BURIED AND AERIAL FIBER NETWORK TO BE INCORPORATED INTO THE LOCAL INCUMBENT'S EXISTING NETWORK.

THE BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT OUTLINES PRE-DEPLOYMENT ACTIVITIES TO PREPARE FOR FULL DEPLOYMENT. THE PROJECT PROPOSES TO DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT AN ON-RESERVATION TECHNOLOGY CENTER POD TO PROVIDE SPACE FOR OVERSIGHT AND ADMINISTRATION OF THE OPEN ACCESS NETWORK (OAN), AS PART OF A LARGER BROADBAND INITIATIVE TO COLLABORATE WITH OTHER TELECOMMUNICATIONS COMPANIES IN THE AREA TO DELIVER HIGH SPEED INTERNET SERVICES TO TRIBAL RESIDENTS AND TRIBAL FACILITIES THAT CURRENTLY DO NOT HAVE ACCESS TO BASIC INTERNET SERVICES.

THE BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT PROPOSES TO DEPLOY A 1.8-MILE FIBER CONNECTION TO CONNECT UNSERVED TRIBAL GOVERNMENT BUILDINGS AND 46 TRIBAL HOMES, AND PURCHASE CUSTOMER PREMISES EQUIPMENT AS PART OF A 2.5 GHZ DEPLOYMENT.  ADDITIONALLY, A SERVICE CABINET WILL BE PURCHASED AND ERECTED WHICH WILL PROVIDE A MEANS TO CONNECT THE 1.8-MILE PROJECT TO PHASE II, WHICH WILL PREPARE THE TRIBE TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO BROADBAND SERVICES FOR ALL TRIBAL MEMBERS WITH ADDITIONAL FUNDING.

THIS BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT PROPOSES TO PURCHASE CONDUIT REELS THAT WILL BE USED FOR THE INSTALLATION OF A FUTURE FIBER NETWORK THAT WILL PROVIDE SERVICE TO 475 UNSERVED TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS, 11 BUSINESSES, AND 25 COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS.
THIS BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT PROPOSES TO CONSTRUCT A FIXED WIRELESS NETWORK CONNECTING 200 UNSERVED NATIVE AMERICAN HOUSEHOLDS TO QUALIFYING SERVICE OF 100/20 MBPS.

THIS DUAL BROADBAND USE AND ADOPTION AND PLANNING, ENGINEERING, FEASIBILITY, AND SUSTAINABILITY PROJECT WILL PROVIDE BROADBAND SUBSIDIES FOR ELIGIBLE TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS AND FUND PRE-CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES TO PROVIDE FUTURE BROADBAND SERVICE TO 289 TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS, 9 TRIBALLY OWNED BUSINESSES, AND 31 TRIBAL COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS.  THIS PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO ENABLE BROADBAND ADOPTION ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING TELEHEALTH AND REMOTE LEARNING, AND PREPARE THE SWINOMISH INDIAN TRIBAL COMMUNITY FOR THEFUTURE DEPLOYMENT OF A ~47.5-MILE MIDDLE- AND LAST-MILE FIBER NETWORK THAT WILL BE DEPLOYED BOTH AERIALLY AND UNDERGROUND.

THE PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES AIMED AT ADDRESSING CRITICAL CHALLENGES FACED BY THE NATIVE AMERICANS IN THE TRIBAL SERVICE AREA:         PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL ENGINEERING SERVICES AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT.        CONSTRUCT PROPOSED FIBER FACILITIES CONSISTING OF ENTIRELY BURIED FIBER LARGELY ALONG EXISTING PRE-DISTURBED ROAD RIGHTS-OF-WAY CREATING TWO  FIBER ACCESS POINTS CONNECTING TO EXISTING TRIBAL FIBER.        PURCHASE ELECTRONICS NEEDED TO OPERATE THE BROADBAND BACKBONE NETWORK.

THIS PLANNING, ENGINEERING, FEASIBILITY, AND SUSTAINABILITY PROJECT WILL CREATE A COMPLETE ENGINEERING, REGULATORY, AND DESIGN PLAN FOR NEW BROADBAND OF 2.5 GHZ SPECTRUM CAPACITY TO THE UNSERVED TRIBAL LANDS IN DOUGLAS COUNTY, OREGON TO ENABLE EFFECTIVE WIRELESS DELIVERY OF 25/3 MBPS BROADBAND SERVICE TO ALL RESIDENTS, BUSINESSES, AND ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS IN THE COMMUNITY.

THE PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES AIMED AT ADDRESSING CRITICAL CHALLENGES FACED BY THE NATIVE AMERICANS IN THE TRIBAL SERVICE AREA: PAY FOR FAA AND FCC DUE DILIGENCE.   CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL STUDIES IN COMPLIANCE WITH NEPA REQUIREMENTS.   CONSTRUCT OVERHEAD POWER POLES TO PROVIDE ELECTRICITY TO THE NEW TOWER.    CONSTRUCT A NEW WIRELESS TOWER, INCLUDING A CONCRETE PIER WITH GROUND RING AND CHAIN LINK SECURITY FENCE, AS WELL AS TOWER ENGINEERING, GEOTECHNICAL REPORTING, FOUNDATION DESIGN, ENGINEERED TOWER DRAWINGS, INSPECTIONS, AND TESTS.       CONDUCT ANALYSIS TO DETERMINE BEST MEANS FOR DEPLOYING A FUTURE MICROWAVE MIDDLE- AND LAST-MILE NETWORK.

THE PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES AIMED AT ADDRESSING CRITICAL CHALLENGES FACED BY THE NATIVE AMERICANS IN THE TRIBAL SERVICE AREA:         PURCHASE EQUIPMENT AND VEHICLES FOR FUTURE DEPLOYMENT AND CURRENT MAINTENANCE OF BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE.

PROJECT PURPOSE/TYPE       THE PROJECT WILL CONNECT THE VARIOUS SECTIONS OF THE TRIBAL LAND INCLUDING HOUSING, THE CURRENT TRIBAL FACILITIES, AND ANY NEW PROJECTS.  TELEHEALTH, TELEWORK, AND EDUCATIONAL NEEDS THAT BENEFIT THE MEMBERS WILL BE AVAILABLE OR IMPROVED.  BATTLE MOUNTAIN BAND:          COLONY: THE AREA LOCATED NORTHWEST OF THE CITY OF BATTLE MOUNTAIN, NEVADA.  THE COLONY IS THE ORIGINAL HOUSING AND ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS ON THE BATTLE MOUNTAIN BAND RESERVATION.  THERE ARE THIRTY-ONE (31) HOUSES LOCATED IN THE COLONY ON THE BATTLE MOUNTAIN BAND RESERVATION.         COLONY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS: LOCATED NORTHWEST OF THE CITY OF BATTLE MOUNTAIN, NEVADA.  THE NINE (9) ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS INCLUDE THE ADMINISTRATION BUILDING, COMMUNITY CENTER, SENIOR CENTER, DIABETES CENTER, YOUTH CENTER, POLICE BUILDING, EPA BUILDING, LIBRARY, LANGUAGE BUILDING, AND SMOKE SHOP.  THERE IS ALSO A PARK ON THE COLONY LOCATED BY THE EVENT CENTER.         NEW COLONY: THE AREA LOCATED WEST OF I-80 ON ALLEN

THE TE-MOAK TRIBE WILL UTILIZE THE FIRST PHASE OF THEIR BROADBAND PROJECT BY CONCENTRATING ON OBTAINING FIBER TO THEIR CURRENT ADMINISTRATIVE BUILDING. WHITE CLOUD COMMUNICATION, THE BROADBAND SERVICE PROVIDER, DESIGNED A FIBER TO THE PREMISES SYSTEM MADE UP OF UNDERGROUND FIBER, AND/OR AIR FIBER TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE TE-MOAK TRIBE. THIS UTILIZATION OF MULTIPLE TECHNOLOGIES WILL HELP ENSURE SUCCESSFUL CONNECTIVITY FOR THE TRIBAL MEMBERS.

THE PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES AIMED AT ADDRESSING CRITICAL CHALLENGES FACED BY THE NATIVE AMERICANS IN THE TRIBAL SERVICE AREA:         DEVELOP PLANNING, DESIGN, AND ENGINEERING DOCUMENTS, AS WELL AS STATEMENTS OF PROBABLE COST FOR PORTIONS OF THE PUEBLO NAMBE BROADBAND DEPLOYMENT PROJECT.         DEPLOY UNDERGROUND FIBER.          ACQUIRE ADDITIONAL FIBER AND AERIAL POLES.         DEVELOP AND PREPARE NEPA ASSESSMENTS.        EMPLOY PROJECT AND GRANT MANAGEMENT SERVICES.

THE PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES AIMED AT ADDRESSING CRITICAL CHALLENGES FACED BY THE NATIVE AMERICANS IN THE TRIBAL SERVICE AREA:         DEVELOPMENT OF PLANNING, DESIGN, AND ENGINEERING DOCUMENTS AND STATEMENT OF PROBABLE COSTS FOR A SHOVEL-READY BROADBAND FIBER DEPLOYMENT PROJECT.  THE DESIGN WILL INCLUDE COMMERCIAL GRADE EQUIPMENT FOR THE NETWORK AND UNSERVED HOUSEHOLDS.        DEVELOPMENT AND PREPARATION OF NEPA ASSESSMENTS AND RELATED  DOCUMENTS.

THE BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT PROPOSES TO DEPLOY A SINGLE TOWER TO PROVIDE FIXED WIRELESS TO THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY CENTER AND ALL HOUSES WITHIN LINE OF SIGHT.  THE COMMUNITY CENTER HOUSES THE TRIBAL COUNCIL CHAMBER, ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES, AND MEDICAL SERVICES.  THIS TOWER WILL PROVIDE ACCESS TO THE UPPERMOST SECTION OF THE RESERVATION LAND.   THE PROJECT PROPOSES THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:           SINGLE TOWER DEPLOYMENT.        PHASE II PLANNING FOR PROJECT.  THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE INTERNET SERVICE TO AT LEAST NINE HOUSEHOLDS AND THE COMMUNITY CENTER, WITH THE COMMUNITY CENTER HAVING INTERNET ACCESS, TRIBAL MEMBERS WILL ALSO HAVE ACCESS AT THE CENTER OR WITHIN PARKING DISTANCE OF THE CENTER.  THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE INTERNET TO STUDENTS WHO ARE DOING SCHOOLWORK OR ONLINE CLASSES.   BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE INTERNET SERVICE TO AT LEAST NINE HOUSEHOLDS AND THE COMMUNITY CENTER.

INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:   CONSTRUCT A 0.5-MILE FIBER NETWORK TO CONNECT 21 TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS AND ONE COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTION TO QUALIFYING SERVICE.   ERECT A 30-FOOT UTILITY POLE AND OUTFIT WITH LTE EQUIPMENT TO PROVIDE 2.5 GHZ FIXED WIRELESS SERVICE TO 38 UNSERVED TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS.   DEPLOY 0.5 MILES OF AERIAL FIBER BACKHAUL RUNNING FROM THE TRIBAL CENTER TO A RAN SITE.

THIS BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT WILL DEPLOY A TOWER, SHELTER/CENTRAL OFFICE, FIBER FEED TO THE TOWER, AND PROCURE OTHER EQUIPMENT NEEDED UNDER THIS FIRST PHASE OF CONSTRUCTION.  THIS REVISED SERVICE AREA WILL REDUCE THE NUMBER OF SUBSCRIBERS FROM 300 IN THE FIRST SIX MONTHS TO 200 WITHIN THE FIRST SIX MONTHS OF DEPLOYMENT, INCREASING TO 400 BY THE END OF THE 12 MONTHS AFTER DEPLOYMENT.   THE PROJECT PROPOSES THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  PRECONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES TO INCLUDE ENGINEERING AND DESIGN AND ONE TOWER DEPLOYMENT. CONSTRUCTION WITH FIBER TO THE TOWER.  THE PROJECT WILL DISTRIBUTE FTTH FIBER CABLE TO THE 40 HOMESITES AND TWO PUBLIC FACILITIES ON COLONY TRUST LANDS.  THE PROJECT WILL USE 5G AND 4G EQUIPMENT ON THE TOWER TO PROVIDE BROADBAND SPEEDS TO ALL UNSERVED AND UNDERSERVED PERSONS IN THE SERVICE AREA, USING BOTH FIBER AND WIRELESS PROVISIONING.  THE TOWER, FACILITIES, EQUIPMENT, AND OPERATIONS WILL BE LOCATED ON THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE 20-ACRE PARCE

THE BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT PROPOSES TO CONSTRUCT A 195-FOOT SELF-SUSTAINING COMMUNICATIONS TOWER, REPLACING EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE THAT HAS REACHED THE END OF ITS LIFE CYCLE.  THIS PROJECT WILL SERVE 20 NATIVE AMERICAN COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS AND 60 UNSERVED NATIVE AMERICAN HOUSEHOLDS.   THE PROJECT PROPOSES THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO, AND USE OF, BROADBAND SERVICES AMONG TRIBAL MEMBERS:  CONSTRUCT A 195-FOOT 900 SERIES COMMUNICATIONS TOWER FOR LSN SERVICES.  CONSOLIDATE TOWER EQUIPMENT AND POWER STRUCTURES INTO ONE SUPPORT BUILDING.  INSTALL 6 MILES OF FIBER CABLE TO CONNECT TWO EXISTING END POINTS OF CABLE PREVIOUSLY LAID TO ALL TRIBAL BUILDINGS.

THIS BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT PROPOSES TO PLAN AND DESIGN A RAN NETWORK INCORPORATING 5 LEASED AND OWNED TOWER SITES COVERING 159 UNSERVED LOCATIONS.  THROUGH 2.5 GHZ WIRELESS SPECTRUM, THE TRIBE WILL INCREASE ITS MEMBERS' ABILITY TO ACCESS EDUCATIONAL AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES, IN ADDITION TO EXPANDING DIGITAL INCLUSION EFFORTS.

THIS BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT AIMS TO REPLACE END OF LIFE AND/OR DAMAGED FIBER STRANDS WITHIN AN EXISTING BROADBAND NETWORK FIBER RING THAT WILL SUPPORT EDUCATIONAL, HEALTHCARE, AND ECONOMIC ACTIVITIES WHILE CLOSING THE DIGITAL DIVIDE THAT EXISTS ON TRIBAL LANDS.  PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:   REPLACE 5 KM OF FIBER ALONG ROUTE 190.  WORK WITH CURRENT ISP TO PROVIDE CALIX CARDS FOR TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS AND LAST-MILE CONNECTIVITY. ENSURE NEW NETWORK SUPPORTS 100/100 MBPS DOWNLOAD AND UPLOAD SPEEDS WITH LESS THAN 100 MILLISECOND (MS) LATENCY.

PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:   - REPLACE 5 KM OF FIBER ALONG ROUTE 190.      - WORK WITH CURRENT ISP TO PROVIDE CALIX CARDS FOR TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS AND LAST-MILE CONNECTIVITY.  - ENSURE NEW NETWORK SUPPORTS 100/100 MBPS DOWNLOAD AND UPLOAD SPEEDS WITH LESS THAN 100 MILLISECOND (MS) LATENCY.   THE PROJECT OUTCOMES WILL RESULT IN THE REPLACEMENT OF AERIAL FIBER WITH UNDERGROUND FIBER, WHICH WILL REPLACE END-OF-LIFE FIBER AND PROVIDE BETTER NETWORK RESILIENCY. ADDITIONALLY, THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE MORE CONSISTENT BROADBAND SERVICES ABOVE THE MINIMUM 25/3 THRESHOLD WHILE ENSURING BETTER ACCESS TO EDUCATIONAL AND TELEHEALTH OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS.    THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT 250 TRIBAL MEMBER HOUSEHOLDS, 20 COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS, AND 35 TRIBAL BUSINESSES.  APPROXIMATELY 21% OF TRIBAL MEMBERS LIVE BELOW THE 150% FEDERAL POVERTY LINE.

THIS BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT AND USE AND ADOPTION PROJECT AIMS TO REPLACE END OF LIFE FIBER WITH NEWER UPGRADES WHICH WILL SERVICE EXISTING PUBLIC WI-FI AT COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS AND REPLACE END OF LIFE EQUIPMENT.  WITH UPGRADED BROADBAND CAPABILITIES, THE APPLICANT WILL CREATE A TECHNOLOGY LEARNING CENTER FOR STAFF AND TRIBAL MEMBERS, WHICH WILL FURTHER DIGITAL INCLUSION EFFORTS TO INCLUDE EDUCATIONAL AND WORKFORCE OPPORTUNITIES, PUBLIC HEALTH, AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.  PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:   - PUBLIC OUTREACH TO TRIBAL MEMBERS FOR BROADBAND EDUCATION.   - CREATION OF A MULTI-YEAR USE AND OPERATIONS PLAN.  - REPLACEMENT OF END-OF-LIFE EQUIPMENT.  - CREATION OF PUBLIC WI-FI.  - 22 MILES OF FIBER BACKBONE REPLACEMENT.  - CONSTRUCTION OF CELLULAR TOWERS CONTRACTED BY LOCAL ISP.   THIS PROJECT WILL CREATE A LONG-TERM BROADBAND PLAN, IMPROVING USE AND ADOPTION BY TRIBAL MEMBERS.  ADDITIONALLY, UPGRADED FIBER AND EQUIPMENT WILL CREATE A STABLE NETWORK TH

PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:   - IMPLEMENT FUNCTIONAL BACKHAUL SUPPORTING LAST MILE CONNECTIVITY.  - CONSTRUCT NEW FIBER FOR TOWER CONNECTING THE HYDRO COMMUNITY.  - EXPAND OR REPLACE EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE/EQUIPMENT TO MEET MINIMUM 25/3 SPEEDS.  - PROVIDE TRAINING FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS ON SYSTEM BASICS DURING INSTALLATION.  - WORK WITH TRIBAL ENTITIES FOR SUBSCRIBER INSTALLATIONS.  - PARTNER WITH EXISTING ISPS FOR NETWORK SUSTAINABILITY/MAINTENANCE (NOT DUPLICATE SERVICE TO HOMES).   THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 1060 TRIBAL MEMBERS AND ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS WITHIN THE PROPOSED SERVICE AREA, 324 OF WHICH LIVE BELOW THE 150% FEDERAL POVERTY LINE.

THIS BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT WILL DEPLOY A WIRELESS BROADBAND SOLUTION COMPOSED OF 2 INITIAL ACCESS POINTS, PROVIDING PUBLIC ACCESS WI-FI AT COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS AND A PUBLIC MARKET.  THIS NETWORK WILL SERVE AS THE BACKBONE FOR FUTURE INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS THAT WILL ESTABLISH LAST MILE CONNECTIONS TO NATIVE AMERICAN HOUSEHOLDS. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:   - CONDUCT TECHNICAL ASSESSMENTS FOR FINAL SITE PREPARATIONS, PERMITS, AND ANY NECESSARY ENVIRONMENTAL STUDIES.  - CONSTRUCTION OF 2 ACCESS TOWERS AT THE MAIN TRIBAL COMPLEX AND COMMUNITY MARKET.  - CONNECT TOWERS WITH APPLICABLE FIBER RING AND INSTALL CORE EQUIPMENT.   THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT 4,904 TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS, OF WHICH 38% FALL BELOW THE 150% FEDERAL POVERTY LINE, IN ADDITION TO APPROXIMATELY 244 TRIBAL BUSINESSES AND 34 COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS BY CONNECTING THE TWO COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS .

THE PROJECT WILL HAVE A SUBSTANTIAL IMPACT IN THE PROJECT AREA BY CONNECTING 17 HOUSEHOLDS THAT CURRENTLY LACK ACCESS TO QUALIFYING BROADBAND SERVICE (I.E., THOSE NOT CURRENTLY RECEIVING INTERNET SERVICE WITH SPEEDS OF 25/3 MBPS OR GREATER).  THE PROJECT IS DESIGNING THE PROPOSED NETWORK TO CONNECT ALL OF THESE LOCATIONS WITH ACCESS TO A FIRST-IN-CLASS GIGABIT NETWORK OFFERING MARKET-LEADING SPEEDS OF UP TO 1000 MBPS/500 MBPS WITH VERY LOW LATENCY, TRANSFORMING THE BROADBAND OFFERINGS AVAILABLE IN THE COMMUNITY.   1.      4.1 MILE MIXED BURIED/AERIAL BUILD USING EXISTING POLES WHEN/WHERE POSSIBLE. 2.      SPEEDS UP TO 1 GBPS SYMMETRICAL. 3.      CONNECTING 17 HOMES IN THE SETTLEMENT AREA.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL INSTALL NECESSARY INFRASTRUCTURE TO LAY THE GROUNDWORK FOR THE FUTURE GOALS OF THE POTAWATOMI NATION TO CONNECT ALL HOUSEHOLDS, AS WELL AS UNCONNECTED BUSINESSES AND COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS, VIA A FIBER NETWORK OFFERING MINIMUM 1 GBPS END USER SPEEDS.  THIS WILL INCLUDE INSTALLATION OF 3.5 MILES OF 4-WAY INNERDUCT, 1.5 MILES OF 7-WAY INNERDUCT, AND 27 HAND HOLES.

THIS BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A 3.5 GHZ CBRS SPECTRUM BROADBAND NETWORK COVERING 99.74% OF TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS WITH MINIMUM 25/3 BROADBAND SPEEDS.  THE PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT TWO FIXED FWA NETWORK SITES UTILIZING AN EXISTING TOWER AND THE CONSTRUCTION OF AN ADDITIONAL TOWER.   PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:         DESIGN AND ENGINEER AN LTE RAN TRANSPORT NETWORK WITH FIBER AND MICROWAVE TECHNOLOGY.         UPGRADE EQUIPMENT FOR EXISTING TOWER IN THE WHITE EAGLE AREA.         CONSTRUCT NEW 15 FEET LATTICE TOWER IN THE MARLAND AREA.

THE BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT INCORPORATES THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:   - APPLICANT WILL CONTRACT WITH AN ENGINEERING FIRM TO IDENTIFY A LOCATION FOR A 2.5 GHZ BROADBAND TOWER.   - UPON COMPLETION OF THE PLANNING PORTION OF THE PROJECT, CONTRACT WITH SPECIALTY TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES (STS) TO CONSTRUCT AND MANAGE NEW WIRELESS TOWER.  - COMPLETE RF ENGINEERING STUDY FOR SYSTEM DESIGN SUPPORTED BY FIBER CONSTRUCTION BY STS.  - LAST-MILE CONNECTION FOR COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS WITHIN MINIMUM 25/3 MBPS.    THIS PROJECT'S BENEFICIARIES WILL BE TRIBAL COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS AND 450 TRIBAL MEMBERS, 203 OF WHICH ARE BELOW THE 150% FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL.

THIS PLANNING, FEASIBILITY, ENGINEERING, AND SUITABILITY PROJECT AIMS TO DESIGN A FUTURE SHOVEL-READY BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT UTILIZING MIDDLE AND LAST-MILE FIBER CONNECTIONS IN ADDITION TO FIXED WIRELESS CONNECTIVITY CONNECTIONS.  A COMPREHENSIVE PLAN WILL PROVIDE TRIBAL MEMBERS AND ENTITIES BETTER ACCESS TO EDUCATION, TELEHEALTH, AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES, IN ADDITION TO CLOSING THE DIGITAL DIVIDE.

THIS BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT WILL ENHANCE WI-FI INFRASTRUCTURE LOCATED ON TRIBAL LAND AND SEEK TO ENHANCE OPPORTUNITIES TO UTILIZE THE TRIBE'S RECENTLY SECURED FCC 2.5 GHZ LICENSE.    PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:   - BUILD OUT REMAINING 20% OF BROADBAND NETWORK WITHIN THE CATTARAUGUS TERRITORY NOT FUNDED BY PREVIOUS PROJECTS SUPPORTING FTTP NETWORK AND PROVIDING WIRELESS NETWORKS TO TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS.   - CONSTRUCT 2 FIBER HUTS THAT WILL HOUSE CALIX EQUIPMENT.   - PROVIDE WIRELESS INFRASTRUCTURE FOR PUBLIC WI-FI IN COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS.  - ESTABLISH WIRELESS CONNECTIONS THROUGH EQUIPMENT PURCHASE FOR LAST MILE CONNECTIONS.   TRIBAL MEMBERS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO FREE PUBLIC WI-FI AT COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS.  ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL UTILIZE THE PURCHASE OF CALIX EQUIPMENT TO SUPPORT END USER CONNECTIONS WITHIN TRIBAL RESIDENCES AND BUSINESSES.

THIS PLANNING, DESIGN, AND ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT PROJECT WILL FUND PRECONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES THAT WILL PROVIDE FUTURE FIBER BROADBAND SERVICE TO 20 TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS AND SIX TRIBAL BUSINESSES; DESIGN OF NEW WIRELESS TOWER, ACCESS ROAD, AND DATA CENTER; PRECONSTRUCTION NEPA COMPLIANCE FOR THE ANTICIPATED GROUND-DISTURBING ACTIVITIES OF BUILDING THE WIRELESS TOWER ACCESS ROAD, INSTALLING THE UTILITIES, BUILDING THE WIRELESS TOWER AND BUILDING THE FUTURE DATA CENTER TO SERVE THE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT NEEDS; PROVISION OF LOWERED COST, ROBUST, EASILY SCALABLE, FUTURE-PROOF, BROADBAND SERVICE EXCEEDING SPEEDS OF 100MBS. THIS USE AND ADOPTION PROJECT WILL PREPAY BROADBAND SERVICE FOR 115 TRIBAL MEMBERS FOR A PERIOD OF TWO YEARS.

THE PROPOSED PLANNING, ENGINEERING, FEASIBILITY, AND SUSTAINABILITY PROJECT WILL FUND ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENTS, DESIGN AND ENGINEERING, AND ACQUISITION OF MATERIALS TO CREATE A FIBER-TO-THE-HOME (FTTP) LAST MILE NETWORK TO THE 25 NATIVE AMERICAN HOUSEHOLDS ON THE BRIDGEPORT INDIAN COLONY RESERVATION, AS WELL AS TO SUPPORT THE COMMUNITY'S ADMINISTRATIVE RESOURCES. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE BRIDGEPORT INDIAN COLONY WITH ITS OWN LAST MILE INFRASTRUCTURE CAPABLE OF SUPPORTING UP TO 10 GIGABITS AND THE PLANNED SERVICE WILL PROVIDE SPEED OF 1 GIGABIT.
THIS EQUITABLE DISTRIBUTION PROJECT WILL EQUIP SIX (6) COMMUNITY CENTERS/BUSINESS INCUBATORS WITH COMPUTER STATIONS AND ONLINE TRAINING COURSES FOR THE APPROXIMATELY 3,343 WHITE EARTH TRIBAL MEMBERS.
THIS BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT PROPOSES TO DEPLOY LAST MILE FTTH TO 39 UNSERVED TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS ON THE COLUSA RANCHERIA WITH BROADBAND SPEEDS OF 30/30 MBPS AND MINIMAL LATENCY.

THE PLANNING, ENGINEERING, FEASIBILITY, AND SUSTAINABILITY PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THE PRE-CONSTRUCTION PLANNING OF A FIBER-TO-THE HOME (FTTH) NETWORK AND WILL INCLUDE AN ENVIRONMENTAL/CULTURAL RESOURCES ASSESSMENT, DESIGN AND ENGINEERING, AND PURCHASE OF FIBER EQUIPMENT. THE PROJECT INTENDS TO BENEFIT 30 TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS, TRIBAL GOVERNMENTAL OFFICES, AND ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS ON THE RANCHERIA WITH FUTURE BROADBAND DEPLOYMENT OF SPEEDS THAT AT LEAST MEET THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS OF 25/3 MBPS.
THIS BROADBAND USE AND ADOPTION PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE COST OF PREPAID BROADBAND SERVICE FOR THE BENEFIT OF (1,102) TRIBAL HOUSEHOLDS FOR A PERIOD OF ONE-YEAR.

THIS PLANNING, ENGINEERING, FEASIBILITY, AND SUSTAINABILITY PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THE PRE-CONSTRUCTION PLANNING OF A BROADBAND NETWORK WHICH WILL ULTIMATELY ALLOW THE TRIBE TO PROVIDE A SERVICE LEVEL ABOVE 25/3 MBPS AND UNDER 100 MS LATENCY FOR ALL 574 HOUSEHOLDS, 55 BUSINESSES, AND 27 ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS ON THE BISHOP PAIUTE RESERVATION.  THE PROJECT CONSISTS OF PLANNING, MAPPING, AND ENGINEERING IN PREPARATION FOR DEPLOYMENT OF A BROADBAND NETWORK COMPRISING A FIBER TO THE HOME (FTTH) SOLUTION COVERING 50% OF HOUSEHOLDS AND A COST-EFFECTIVE LTE NETWORK SITE OPERATING IN THE 2.5 GHZ EBS SPECTRUM BAND COVERING 50% OF HOUSEHOLDS.  THE NETWORK WILL PROVIDE SERVICES FOCUSED ON RESIDENTIAL, BUSINESS, AND INSTITUTIONAL USERS.  FUTURE BROADBAND SERVICES OF 50/10 THROUGH LTE AND 100/20 OVER FIBER WILL BE OFFERED.

STOCKBRIDGE-MUNSEE COMMUNITY (SMC) BROADBAND COMMUNITY OUTREACH PROJECT WILL AID NATIVE AMERICAN HOUSEHOLDS, MANY OF WHOM ARE LOW-INCOME FAMILIES, IN OVERCOMING THE FINANCIAL BARRIERS CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC BY PROVIDING TABLETS AND PREPAID BROADBAND SERVICE FOR ONE YEAR.

DURING THE INITIAL CURING PHASE, THE TBCP TEAM ASKED THE TRIBE TO EXPLAIN WHETHER ITS APPLICATION FOR A BROADBAND USE AND ADOPTION PROJECT ALSO INCLUDED ELEMENTS OF A BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT PROJECT.  IN RESPONSE, THE TRIBE SUBMITTED A LETTER FROM ITS LEGAL COUNSEL DESCRIBING WHY THE PROJECT FITS UNDER THE ELIGIBLE ACTIVITIES AND USES FOR A BROADBAND USE AND ADOPTION PROJECT, NOTING, IN PARTICULAR, THAT THERE IS NO CONSTRUCTION INVOLVED IN IMPLEMENTING THE PROJECT.

THE FCPC SOLAR BROADBAND PROJECT (FSBP) PROPOSES TO PROVIDE RELIABLE BROADBAND SERVICE TO THE TRIBE'S CRITICAL SOLAR ARRAYS. THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT ECONOMIC AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT CAPACITY IN ADDITION TO IMPROVING THE TRIBE'S RESILIENCE THROUGH INCREASED TELEWORK CAPABILITIES. THE TRIBE WILL USE THE ENHANCED BROADBAND CONNECTIONS TO PRODUCE DATA DOCUMENTING THE PERFORMANCE OF THE TRIBE'S SOLAR PHOTOVOLTAIC (PV) ELECTRICITY GENERATION CAPACITY, ESPECIALLY DURING SNOWSTORMS AND DURING POWER OUTAGES WHEN THE SOLAR PV SYSTEMS WILL CONTINUE TO POWER ESSENTIAL BUILDING ELECTRICITY REQUIREMENTS.  THE TRIBE WILL LEVERAGE THE RESULTING BROADBAND DATA GENERATION TO DOCUMENT THE TRIBE'S PROGRESS TOWARDS BECOMING CARBON NEUTRAL VIA RENEWABLE RESOURCES AND SUPPORT PLANNING FOR FUTURE SOLAR DEVELOPMENT WORK.

IMPROVE THE BROADBAND CAPACITY AND CAPABILITY AT 6 TRIBALLY OWNED FACILITIES.  THESE IMPROVEMENTS WOULD ENABLE THE TRIBE TO ACCELERATE OR AMPLIFY THE ADOPTION AND USE OF BROADBAND FOR SERVICES SUCH AS REMOTE LEARNING, TELEWORK, TELEHEALTH, AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT DURING THE COVID-19.  THIS GRANT REQUEST INTENDS TO BENEFIT OVER 175 KIC EMPLOYEES AND MORE THAN 6,000 ENROLLED TRIBAL MEMBERS.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT CONSISTS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: (1) TECHNICAL AND FEASIBILITY AND ENGINEERING DESIGN - AN ASSESSMENT OF TECHNICAL VIABILITY AND PROJECT POTENTIAL OF OWNING BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE, AS WELL AS CREATION OF BROADBAND DESIGN ENGINEERING; (2) POTENTIAL BROADBAND PARTNERSHIPS FEASIBILITY AND RESEARCH - EVALUATION OF POTENTIAL OF PARTNERING OPPORTUNITIES WITH THIRD PARTY VENDORS FOR BROADBAND DEPLOYMENT AND SERVICES DELIVERY; (3) FINANCIAL AND ORGANIZATIONAL FEASIBILITY - DETERMINATION OF FINANCIAL AND ORGANIZATIONAL VIABILITY AND PROJECT POTENTIAL OF DELIVERING BROADBAND SERVICES; AND (4) INVESTIGATION INTO ADOPTION AND USE OPPORTUNITIES AND CREATION OF ROADMAP - RESEARCH INTO OPPORTUNITIES THAT WOULD EXPAND THE ADOPTION OF BROADBAND SERVICES IN LCO RESERVATION.

THE BROADBAND USE AND ADOPTION PROJECT WILL ASSIST 175 NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBAL CITIZENS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN MENDOCINO, LAKE AND SONOMA COUNTIES, CALIFORNIA, IN DEVELOPING PROGRAMS AND RESOURCES TO ADDRESS COVID-19 RELATED CONCERNS AND BUILD CAPACITY TO USE BROADBAND TO PROVIDE ONGOING AND SUSTAINABLE BENEFIT TO TELEHEALTH, REMOTE LEARNING, TELEWORK, ENTREPRENEURSHIP, ECONOMIC GROWTH, JOB CREATION AND SERVING COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS.

THIS PLANNING STUDY INTENDS TO FUND NETWORK PLANNING ACTIVITIES IN ORDER TO DEVELOP A SOLUTION FOR BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE CONNECTION, CONSTRUCTION, AND SERVICE DEPLOYMENT FOR CURRENTLY UNSERVED NATIVE AMERICAN HOUSEHOLDS, BUSINESSES, AND COMMUNITY ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS IN AND AROUND RESERVATION LAND LOCATED IN LINCOLN COUNTY, OREGON.

THIS PLANNING STUDY WILL GENERATE PLANS AND RECOMMENDATIONS IN ESTABLISHING THE BEST AND MOST COST-EFFECTIVE APPROACH TO UPDATE AND EXPAND BROADBAND CONNECTIVITY FOR THE YAVAPAI-APACHE NATION. THE PLAN WILL LEVERAGE EXPERTS IN BROADBAND OPERATIONS, ENGINEERING, AND DESIGN TO DEVELOP AND DOCUMENT A SUSTAINABLE AND FEASIBLE PLAN FOR FUTURE INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT.

THE BROADBAND USE AND ADOPTION PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AFFORDABLE BROADBAND SERVICES THROUGH PAYMENT ASSISTANCE PROGRAMMING TO NEW AND EXISTING SUBSCRIBERS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE TRIBAL MEMBERS SEEKING TO RE-ENTER THE WORKFORCE WITH QUALIFYING CONNECTED DEVICES (I.E., LAPTOPS OR TABLETS). THESE SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED TO IMPROVE TRIBAL MEMBERS' ACCESS TO TELEHEALTH, DISTANCE LEARNING, TELEWORK, AND OTHER MODERN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES THAT PROMOTE ECONOMIC GROWTH AND JOB CREATION IN THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF SELAWIK.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT, THROUGH A QUALIFIED CONSULTANT, WILL CONDUCT COMPREHENSIVE ENGINEERING ANALYSIS WITH RESPECT TO THE TECHNICAL DESIGN, MARKET CONDITIONS AND FINANCIAL REQUIREMENTS OF PROVIDING BROADBAND SERVICES TO ITS COMMUNITY.

THE BROADBAND USE AND ADOPTION PROJECT WILL COVER THE COSTS OF BROADBAND INTERNET SERVICES FOR ALL MOLE LAKE RESERVATION HOUSEHOLDS (APPROXIMATELY 500 TRIBAL MEMBERS), INCLUDING UPGRADES TO SERVICE (FASTER CONNECTIONS) AND NEW MODEMS AND ROUTERS AS NEEDED. THE IMPROVED INTERNET SPEEDS AND FREE-OF-COST INTERNET SERVICE WILL HELP ENSURE THAT THIS HIGHLY RURAL AND GEOGRAPHICALLY ISOLATED COMMUNITY CAN STAY CONNECTED, WHICH IS ESPECIALLY VITAL AS THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC CONTINUES TO INDUCE SHUTDOWNS AND NECESSITATES VIRTUAL SERVICES OVER IN-PERSON.

THE PROPOSED BROADBAND USE AND ADOPTION PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE ALL TRIBAL MEMBERS WHO HAVE BEEN NEGATIVELY IMPACTED BY THE COVID-19 GLOBAL PANDEMIC WITH ACCESS TO TECHNOLOGY AND INTERNET SERVICES AT ZERO COST IN ORDER TO COMBAT SOCIAL ISOLATION, PROMOTE TELEWORK, BRING REMOTE ACCESS TO COLLEGE/TRAINING COURSES, AND PROVIDE ACCESS TO MEDICAL CARE FROM WITHIN THE HOME.  ALL TRIBAL MEMBERS MAY APPLY FOR THE PROGRAM BY PROVIDING VERIFICATION OF TRIBAL MEMBER STATUS AND SELF-CERTIFYING THAT THEY WERE NEGATIVELY IMPACTED BY COVID-19.

THE BROADBAND USE AND ADOPTION PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AFFORDABLE BROADBAND SERVICES THROUGH PAYMENT ASSISTANCE PROGRAMMING AS WELL AS PROVIDE CITIZENS IN NEED WITH LAPTOPS. THESE SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED TO IMPROVE TRIBAL CITIZENS' ACCESS TO TELEHEALTH, TELE-EDUCATION, AND OTHER MODERN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES THAT PROMOTE JOB GROWTH AND HOUSEHOLD CONNECTIVITY FOR THE UPPER MATTAPONI COMMUNITY.
